short_summary: Consulting services for the Boom Creek Culvert Replacement, Banff National Park including design-build, supply, and installation of a new precast concrete box (PCB) culvert , construction of temporary detour and water diversion
full_summary:
## Invitation to Qualify: Boom Creek Culvert Replacement
### Reference Number: PW-23-01030333

The Government of Canada, through Parks Canada, has announced an invitation to qualify for the Boom Creek Culvert Replacement project in Banff National Park.

### Solicitation Number: 5P468-23-0022/A

The submission closing date is **April 4, 2023, at 16:00 (EDT)**, with the intention to award a contract to replace the existing culvert at Boom Creek km 6.9.

**Project Overview**

Parks Canada requires a design-build solution to:

* Remove the existing Corrugated Steel Pipe Arch (CSPA) culvert
* Install a new Precast Concrete Box (PCB) culvert with an offset to the north
* Construct a temporary detour for traffic during construction
* Manage water diversion

**Submissions**

Bidders must submit their qualifications in two stages. Stage 1 will evaluate the suitability of bidders, while Stage 2 will invite qualified bidders to submit a financial bid.

Submissions must be made via fax or email to [soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca](mailto:soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca) with the subject line: **"5P468-23-0022/A - Boom Creek Culvert Replacement"**. 

* Fax: 1-855-983-1808
* Email file size: maximum 15 megabytes

Late submissions will not be considered.

**Technical and Contractual Enquiries**

All technical and contractual enquiries must be submitted to the Contracting Authority in writing, five (5) business days prior to the submission closing date.

**Legislative Framework**

The National Parks Regulations govern this project, requiring work to be performed in accordance with the National Park Act.

**Value and Contract Period**

The project is estimated to be worth between $1,000,001 and $5,000,000, taxes extra. The contract period is expected to commence on **September 30, 2023, and terminate upon completion**.

Further details can be found in the solicitation document, available on the Government of Canada's eprocurement service, Canadabuy.
